heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 03 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (201°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest windy periods recorded.  This windy period is ranked 7th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 03 October 2025 and has lasted 3 days.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 509 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.6°C) and cloud levels (down 233 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 509.1m higher than yesterday, 326.1m higher than the past week, 233.1m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 817m and a high of 2540m, averaging 1947.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and near calm conditions. Showers, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
